overview: An intimate film made on the occasion of the 30th anniversary  of Vivian Ostrovsky's father, Rehor Ostrovskyâ€™s death. The film is pasted together using artifacts from and footage of places and situations that form a part of the everyday nature of traveling between large cities: the experience of constant travel and disrupted communications. Objects stand for stories from the road; family memories about traveling between countries and cultures remind us of the movement of history.
title: Wherever Was Never There
